    mergeron.ext.xlsxw_helper¶

    Methods for writing data from Python to fresh Excel workbooks using the third-party package, xlsxwriter.

    Includes a flexible system of defining cell formats.

    Notes

    This module is designed for producing formatted summary output. For writing bulk data to Excel, facilities provided in third-party packages such as polars likely provide better performance.

    License¶

    Copyright 2017-2023 S. Murthy Kambhampaty Licese: MIT https://mit-license.org/

    Module Contents¶

    class mergeron.ext.xlsxw_helper.CFmt[source]¶

    Bases: dict, aenum.Enum

    Cell format enums for xlsxwriter Format objects.

    The enums defined here, or sequences of (any of) them and any added with CFmt.add_new(), are rendered as xlsxWriter.Workbook.Format objects with CFmt.xl_fmt().

    Notes

    For more information about xlsxwriter cell formats, see, https://xlsxwriter.readthedocs.io/format.html

    classmethod add_new(_fmt_name, _xlsx_fmt_dict, /)[source]¶

    Add new CFmt object to instance.

    Parameters:¶
    _fmt_name : str¶

    Name of new member to be added to CFmt

    _xlsx_fmt_dict : CFmtVal¶

    Any valid argument to xlsxwriter.Workbook.add_format(), or union of same with one or more CFmt objects, e.g., CFmt.HDR_BORDER | CFmt.HDR_FILL or CFmt.HDR_BORDER | {"pattern": 1, "bg_color": "f2f2f2"}

    Returns:¶

    None

    Return type:¶

    CFmt

    classmethod ensure_cell_format_spec_tuple(_cell_format, /)[source]¶

    Test that a given format specification is a tuple of CFmt enums

    Parameters:¶
    _cell_format : collections.abc.Sequence[CFmt | collections.abc.Sequence[CFmt]]¶

    Format specification

    Raises:¶

    ValueError – If format specification is not a sequence of (sequences of) CFmt enums

    Returns:¶

    True if format specification passes, else False

    Return type:¶

    bool

    classmethod xl_fmt(_xl_book, _cell_fmt, /)[source]¶

    Return xlsxwriter Format object given a CFmt enum, or tuple thereof.

    Parameters:¶

    xlsxwriter.Workbook object

    _cell_fmt : collections.abc.Sequence[CFmt | collections.abc.Sequence[CFmt]] | CFmt | None¶

    CFmt enum object, or tuple thereof

    Raises:¶

    ValueError – If format specification is not one of None, a CFmt enum, or a xlsxwriter.format.Format object

    Returns:¶

    xlsxwriter Format object

    Return type:¶

    xlsxwriter.format.Format

    ValueError – Must specify at least one header

    mergeron.ext.xlsxw_helper.array_to_sheet(_xl_book, _xl_sheet, _data_table, _row_id, _col_id=0, /, *, cell_format=None, empty_as_blank=True, green_bar_flag=True, ragged_flag=True)[source]¶

    Write a 2-D array to a worksheet.

    The given array is required be a two-dimensional array, whether a nested list, nested tuple, or a 2-D numpy ndarray. The array is assumed to be ragged by default, i.e. not all rows are the same length, and some cells may contain lists, etc. For rectangular arrays, set ragged_flag to false if you wish to provide a format tuple with distinct formats for each column in the rectangular array.

    Parameters:¶
    _xl_book : xlsxwriter.workbook.Workbook¶

    Workbook object

    _xl_sheet : xlsxwriter.worksheet.Worksheet¶

    Worksheet object to which to write the give array

    _data_table : collections.abc.Sequence[Any] | numpy.typing.NDArray[Any]¶

    Array to be written

    _row_id : int¶

    Row number of top left corner of range to write to

    _col_id : int¶

    Column number of top left corner of range to write to

    cell_format : collections.abc.Sequence[CFmt | collections.abc.Sequence[CFmt]] | CFmt | None¶

    Format specification for range to be written

    green_bar_flag : bool¶

    Whether to highlight alternating rows as in green bar paper

    ragged_flag : bool¶

    Whether to write ragged array, i.e. rows not all the same length or not all cells are scalar-valued

    Raises:¶

    • ValueError – If array is not two-dimensional

    • ValueError – If ragged_flag is False and array is not rectangular

    • ValueError – If array is not rectangular and cell_format is a Sequence

    • ValueError – If array is rectangular but length of format tuple does not match row-length

    Returns:¶

    Tuple giving address of cell at right below and after range written

    Return type:¶

    tuple[int, int]

    Notes

    The keyword argument cell_format may be passed a tuple of CFmt enums, if, and only if, ragged_flag is False. If cell_format is a tuple, it must have length equal to the number of cells in each row of the passed array. Further, members of cell_format must each be a CFmt enum or a tuple of CFmt enums; in other words, CFmt.ensure_cell_format_spec_tuple() must return True for any tuple _c passed as cell_format.

    mergeron.ext.xlsxw_helper.scalar_to_sheet(_xl_sheet, _cell_addr_0='A1', /, *_s2s_args, empty_as_blank=True)[source]¶

    Write to a single cell in a worksheet.

    Parameters:¶
    _xl_sheet : xlsxwriter.worksheet.Worksheet¶

    Worksheet object to which to write the give array

    _cell_addr_0 : str | int¶

    First element of a cell address, which may be the entire address in ‘A1’ format or the row-part in ‘Row-column’ format

    _s2s_args : Any¶

    Other arguments, which may be just the cell value to be written and the cell format, or the column-part of the ‘Row-column’ address along with cell value and cell format.

    Raises:¶

    • ValueError – If too many or too few arguments

    • ValueError – If incorrect/incomplete specification for Excel cell data

    Returns:¶

    None

    Return type:¶

    None

    Notes

    For more information on xlsxwriter cell-address notation, see: https://xlsxwriter.readthedocs.io/working_with_cell_notation.html
